subject: Management
title: The Check-In Spectrum
description: A 60-second lesson on The Check-In Spectrum.

hook.text: One manager checked in every hour. Another disappeared entirely. Both teams struggled.

buildup.text: Too many check-ins signal distrust. Too few leave people stranded without guidance.

discovery.text: The right cadence depends on the person's experience and the task's risk level.

twist.text: New task + new person = frequent check-ins. Familiar task + veteran = hands off.

climax.text: Agree on check-in points upfront so monitoring feels like support, not surveillance.

punchline.text: Schedule the check-ins. Skip the hovering.

quiz.question: What determines the right check-in frequency for a delegated task?
options: The person's experience and the task's risk
